oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview - Ray Price - 2006-08-05
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with Ray Price by Eddie Stubbs from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on August 5, 2008. In support of the exhibit Ray Price: For The Good Times.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eddie Stubbs; Ray Price;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress/ (00:00) Ray Price talks about his childhood / (00:40) Farming background / (01:15) Mother working for Neiman Marcus and her influence on Ray's appearance / (02:27) first clothes that Ray wore on stage / (03:19) Joining the marine corps and not seeing action / (03:40) Working with a veterinarian and wanting to be a vet / (04:10) First radio work / (04:50) Working with Bullet Records and first recordings / (06:01) signing with Columbia records / (06:38) Art Satherley / (06:54) Being in Texas and working with Columbia Records / (07:30) Working in bars / 08:15) Taking cover from bar fights behind the stand up bass / (08:50) Meeting Hank Williams and writing Weary Blues From Waiting / (11:13) Plays excerpt of recording of Ray Price singing Weary Blues From Waiting introduced by Hank Williams recorded off of the radio / (14:05) Impression of Hank Williams and his influence / (15:30) Effect of Hank Williams' death /

(16:48) Plays commercial recording of I'll Be There / (19:05) Evolving musical styles / (19:40) Starting off with the Cherokee Cowboys and origins of their names / (21:10) Comments on Indian headdresses worn by the Cherokee Cowboys / (22:10) The origins of the Ray Price 4/4 shuffle and the recording of Crazy Arms / (25:00) Plays recording of Crazy Arms / (27:40) Crazy Arms chart success and popularity / (29:04) The effect of Elvis Presley and his music on Ray / (30:48) Plays video of Ray Price performing I've Got A New Heartache / (34:40) Ray credits the great musicians that played with him over the years / (35:15) Hearing Don't Let The Stars Get In Your Eyes for the first time and the recording of it / (37:10) Working with Van Howard / (37:50) Musicians that Ray worked with over the years / (38:27) The role of a session leader / (39:22) Working with future award winning song writers / (40:20) finding the song City Lights / (40:55) Finding Roger Miller /
